title: How I Set-up & Use Drip Irrigation

tasks.task: Set up a drip irrigation system for newly planted ostrich ferns
subtasks: Gather necessary materials (half-inch drip line, timers, punch tool, quarter-inch couplers, clamps)
Attach drip line to timers using punch tool and couplers
Route drip line to ferns' location and make necessary cuts
Secure drip line ends with clamps
Install adjustable drip heads and connect them to the line
Adjust drip head settings for optimal watering
Test and recalibrate timers for correct irrigation schedule
Inspect timers and address issues (e.g., replacing broken timers)
Adjust water pressure and zone configurations for efficient watering
Inspect and maintain drip line connections to prevent leaks

tasks.task: Plan and prepare for future landscaping projects
subtasks: Research fertilizer injection systems for drip irrigation
Organize drip irrigation supplies for easy access
Consider purchasing new equipment (e.g., better timers, fertilizer injectors)

tasks.task: Water sensitive plants manually when necessary
subtasks: Check for adequate water distribution around plant bases
Adjust watering schedules based on weather conditions and soil moisture
Use manual hand watering as a backup for high-need plants.
